intro: Masdevallia aurea, commonly known as the golden masdevallia, is a species of orchid native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and its striking golden-yellow flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically produces a single spike of blooms, each flower featuring three petals and three sepals that are often adorned with contrasting color markings. It thrives in cool, high-altitude environments with high humidity and bright, indirect light. Masdevallia aurea is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its beauty and relatively easy care requirements.
